title: How to Unzip a File on Any Device: Easy Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Double-click the ZIP file.
steps.content: Double-click the ZIP file. This displays the contents in a File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click Extract all.
steps.content: Click Extract all . On Windows 10, the icon looks like a folder with a zipper and four blue squares near the top of the window. On Windows 11, you'll see Extract All in the toolbar.

steps.title: Check the box next to "Show extracted files when complete."
steps.content: Check the box next to "Show extracted files when complete." It's at the bottom-left corner of the window. This makes it so you'll be taken to the unzipped files as soon as they are unzipped.

steps.title: Select a folder to unzip to.
steps.content: Select a folder to unzip to. If you want to place the unzipped files in a location other than the current folder in which the ZIP folder is stored, do the following: Click Browse... on the right side of the window. Click the name of the folder where you want to store the unzipped folder. Click Select Folder .

steps.title: Click Extract.
steps.content: Click Extract . It's at the bottom of the window. This extracts the ZIP file's contents to an unzipped folder in the selected location. Now, you can work with the files inside the folder.

steps.title: Copy the ZIP file to a different location (optional).
steps.content: Copy the ZIP file to a different location (optional). When you unzip a file, the contents will be extracted to the same folder as the ZIP file. If you want to extract the contents somewhere else, you can move the ZIP file before unzipping. Here's how: Click the ZIP file to select it. Click Edit on the upper-left side of the screen. Click Copy in the drop-down menu. Go to the folder where you want to store the ZIP folder. Click Edit again, then click Paste .

steps.title: Double-click the ZIP folder.
steps.content: Double-click the ZIP folder. The contents of the ZIP will now be extracted to a new folder in the current folder. When the files are unzipped, the folder containing your files will appear.

steps.title: Open a terminal window.
steps.content: Open a terminal window. Click the Terminal app icon on your desktop or press Ctrl + Alt + T to open one now.

steps.title: Switch to the ZIP file directory.
steps.content: Switch to the ZIP file directory. Type cd and a space, type the path to the folder where the ZIP is located, and press Enter . For example, if the ZIP file is in the "Downloads" directory, you would enter cd Downloads into Terminal. If the ZIP file is in a folder called "ZIP" inside the "Downloads" folder, you would need to enter cd Downloads/ZIP .

steps.title: Enter the "unzip" command.
steps.content: Enter the "unzip" command. Type in unzip file.zip where file is the file's name, then press Enter to run it. This extracts the files to the current directory. If the file's name has spaces in it, you'll place quotation marks on either side of "file.zip" (e.g., unzip "this is a zipped folder.zip" ). The Linux unzip command doesn't create a new folder for the unzipped files.

steps.title: Open the Files app.
steps.content: Open the Files app. It's the blue icon labeled "Files" in your app list. You can also find it by swiping right across the home screen until you reach the "App Library" screen and tapping the Productivity & Finance folder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the location of the ZIP file.
steps.content: Go to the location of the ZIP file. If the file is on your iPhone, for example, tap On My iPhone . And if it's saved in a certain folder, tap that folder to open it now .

steps.title: Tap the ZIP file.
steps.content: Tap the ZIP file. This instantly creates a folder containing the contents of the ZIP file. You can rename this folder if you'd like. Tap and hold the folder and select Rename to do so.

steps.title: Tap the folder to open it.
steps.content: Tap the folder to open it. This displays the contents of the ZIP file.

steps.title: Install the Files by Google app on your Android.
steps.content: Install the Files by Google app on your Android. If you already have the "Files" app in your app drawer, you can open it now. However, some Androids come with different "Files" apps, and they may not be able to unzip files . Here's how to install Google's official Files app: Open the Play Store. Type files by google into the search bar. Tap Files by Google in the search results. Tap Install to download the app. If you already have the app, you won't see this optionâ€”you'll see Open instead.

steps.title: Open Files by Google.
steps.content: Open Files by Google. It's the blue folder icon with a turned-down corner that's several different colors. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Browse.
steps.content: Tap Browse . It's the folder icon with a magnifying glass.

steps.title: Go to the folder that contains your ZIP file.
steps.content: Go to the folder that contains your ZIP file. For example, if it's in your Downloads folder, select that folder.

steps.title: Tap the ZIP file.
steps.content: Tap the ZIP file. A pop-up will appear, showing you what's inside the file.

steps.title: Tap Extract.
steps.content: Tap Extract . This extracts the files from the compressed ZIP file and displays a preview. If you want to delete the ZIP file after decompressing the file, check the box next to "Delete ZIP file" now.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . The contents of the ZIP file are now extracted to the current folder.
